contributors.headline: Associate Professor at Zhengzhou University & Guest Researcher at Utrecht University

projects.title: The Pivotal Role of Industrial Energy Efficiency to Phase Out Coal, Improve Air Quality and Mitigate Climate Change
projects.description:
Three key knowledge gaps are relevant in this project: 1) How much electricity can be saved in China’s industries and what is the role that electricity plays in the total final energy use; 2) what is the potential impact of industrial electricity savings on the evolution of electricity supply systems among different power grids; and 3) what is the relationship between electricity use, energy efficiency investments, GHG and air pollution emissions, on various spatial scales. Given the identified knowledge gaps, the objective of this project is to conduct an in-depth analysis of electricity saving potentials and cost-benefits of emission mitigation due to scaling up energy efficiency in industries. Our research targets industrial electric efficiency improvements in China, where electricity supply heavily depends on a coal-fired power plant fleet and faces multiple challenges to a sustainable future. To meet the research purpose, the following five sub-goals are established:
1. Comparing electricity use projections and electricity saving potentials for China’s industry in different studies to provide an overview of efficiency improvement opportunities and identify sectors with the highest potential for electricity savings.
2. Understanding the modeling parameters and approaches that affect the studied results across different scenarios.
3. Measuring the multiple benefits of electricity savings in industrial sub-sectors, in terms of GHG and air pollution emission reductions at a power grid level.
4. Quantifying the potential impacts of reduced electricity load from industry on the phaseout of high-polluting coal power units, air emission changes from the power sector, and air pollutant control costs.
5. A comprehensive assessment of the mutual benefits of industrial electricity savings, coal power removal, emission reductions and related investment optimization across provincial and grid level.

projects.title: Research on Optimization Development of Henan Province's Industry Parks based on the Circular Economy
projects.description:
American Energy Foundation - China Sustainable Energy Program / G-1509-23748

The project aims to realize high efficient utilization of resource and energy in the industrial agglomeration areas through the measures of cascade utilization of energy, cleaner production, and recycling of wastewater, etc. It is helpful to reduce the emissions of carbon dioxide and other pollutants, realize the target of finishing the recycling restructure in 30% industrial parks, and enhance the comprehensive competitiveness in Henan’s industrial agglomeration areas. 

The proposed study essentially consists of the following three parts as mentioned before: (1) Establish a comprehensive evaluation index methodology for assessing the development of circular economy in industry agglomeration areas, and grasp the current situation of the energy supply system and industrial chain composition in the industry parks; (2) Construct the circular economy developing patterns for industrial parks with different leading industries, and design the corresponding ecological industry chains and energy cascade utilization process in different industrial agglomeration areas; and (3) Disseminate the well-practiced approaches of recycling development in the industrial agglomeration areas through establishing an information exchange platform and training.

contributors.headline: Associate Professor at Zhengzhou University & Guest Researcher at Utrecht University

projects.title: Research on Henan Province’s Energy Cap and Energy Intensity and the Approaches of Achieving the Targets in the 13th FYP
projects.description:
American Energy Foundation - China Sustainable Energy Program / G-1410-22231

The implementation of Henan’s energy saving control targets during 13th FYP will be analyzed from three aspects: industrial structure adjustment, energy- and cost-reducing, and energy structure optimization. Industrial structure adjustment will include what Henan province should do to increase the proportion of strategic emerging industry and service industry by controlling those sectors with “high energy consumption, high pollution and excess capacity”. The energy-saving and cost-reducing approach will include what Henan province should do to realize energy-saving and cost-reducing in key sectors such as energy supply, industry, construction industry.

This study aims at analyzing the implementation of energy saving control targets in Henan’s 18 cities and 10 counties by proposing adequate management scheme to ensure the achievement of energy saving targets. In general, it contains following two parts. First, a pre-warning system will be proposed to see whether it meets energy saving control targets. On the basis of the current study of energy saving target prediction and pre-warning in 12th FYP, the completion status of energy intensity and consumption targets of 18 cities and 10 counties will be predicted according to the possible development trend of Henan in 13th FYP, and subsequently a pre-warning system will be presented in advance for the non-completion status. Second part is the evaluation of management of total energy consumption in Henan. Based on the present “Management of energy consumption control in Henan during 12th FYP”, by learning from reduction of pollutant emission together with the decomposition methodology of energy saving control targets, the implementation plan of total energy consumption containing quota estimation, decomposition, adjustment and the completion status will be presented .

contributors.headline: Associate Professor at Zhengzhou University & Guest Researcher at Utrecht University

projects.title: Study of Industry Transformation and Upgrading in Henan Province (II)
projects.description:
American Energy Foundation - China Sustainable Energy Program / G-1311-19348

Firstly, we construct a dynamic input-output model to forecast the transformation and upgrading of industrial structure in Henan Province, and evaluate the implementation of 9% annual economic growth target, 33% proportion of tertiary industry, energy-saving targets and GHG mitigation targets in the "12th Five-Year Plan". Secondly, we assess the overall trend of the industrial restructuring, in order to provide the scientific basis in formulating the relevant policies. Finally, we focus on the traditional industry and new industry by analyzing the product capacity, market demand, and technology innovations, and provide some insightful recommendations for industrial structure adjustment in the typical industries.

contributors.headline: Associate Professor at Zhengzhou University & Guest Researcher at Utrecht University

projects.title: Zhengzhou Ecological Civilization Construction Programming Scheme (I)
projects.description:
American Energy Foundation - China Sustainable Energy Program / G-1311-19348

Based on the analysis of current situation, this project will build a dynamic input-output model to forecast the potential of industry restructuring and upgrading in Henan Province. This study will provide the industry development trend, energy consumption and GHG emissions of each sector in Henan Province. Moreover, it can forecast the optimal industrial structure which can coordinate the rapid economic development and GHG mitigation. And it will provide the scientific basis for the policy formulation for the local industrial structure adjustment.

volunteer_experiences.description:
Subject Editor (since 2023)
Energy, Ecology and Environment
https://www.springer.com/journal/40974/aims-and-scope

Energy, Ecology and Environment (E3) is a cross-discipline forum for investigating the energy production and its impacts on ecosystems and environment, clean energy production, sustainable management of global natural resources, sustainable industrial and agricultural production and emission reduction technologies. E3 has been awarded by Springer Nature the top 25% of qualifying journals for editorial excellence.The latest updated Citescore is 6.0, ranking 27 out of 133 (Q1) in the category of “Environmental Science”. The impact factor of 2022 is estimated to be 6.0.
